It is, of course, not possible to describe every conceivable combination of components or methodologies for purposes of describing these examples, but one of ordinary skill in the art can recognize that many further combinations and permutations of the present embodiments are possible. Accordingly, the embodiments disclosed and/or claimed herein are intended to embrace all such alterations, modifications and variations that fall within the spirit and scope of the appended claims. Furthermore, to the extent that the term “includes” is used in either the detailed description or the claims, such term is intended to be inclusive in a manner similar to the term “comprising” as “comprising” is interpreted when employed as a transitional word in a claim.

In addition, a flow diagram may include a “start” and/or “continue” indication. The “start” and “continue” indications reflect that the steps presented can optionally be incorporated in or otherwise used in conjunction with other routines. In this context, “start” indicates the beginning of the first step presented and may be preceded by other activities not specifically shown. Further, the “continue” indication reflects that the steps presented may be performed multiple times and/or may be succeeded by other activities not specifically shown. Further, while a flow diagram indicates a particular ordering of steps, other orderings are likewise possible provided that the principles of causality are maintained.

As may also be used herein, the term(s) “operably coupled to”, “coupled to”, and/or “coupling” includes direct coupling between items and/or indirect coupling between items via one or more intervening items. Such items and intervening items include, but are not limited to, junctions, communication paths, components, circuit elements, circuits, functional blocks, and/or devices. As an example of indirect coupling, a signal conveyed from a first item to a second item may be modified by one or more intervening items by modifying the form, nature or format of information in a signal, while one or more elements of the information in the signal are nevertheless conveyed in a manner than can be recognized by the second item. In a further example of indirect coupling, an action in a first item can cause a reaction on the second item, as a result of actions and/or reactions in one or more intervening items.

Although specific embodiments have been illustrated and described herein, it should be appreciated that any arrangement which achieves the same or similar purpose may be substituted for the embodiments described or shown by the subject disclosure. The subject disclosure is intended to cover any and all adaptations or variations of various embodiments. Combinations of the above embodiments, and other embodiments not specifically described herein, can be used in the subject disclosure. For instance, one or more features from one or more embodiments can be combined with one or more features of one or more other embodiments. In one or more embodiments, features that are positively recited can also be negatively recited and excluded from the embodiment with or without replacement by another structural and/or functional feature. The steps or functions described with respect to the embodiments of the subject disclosure can be performed in any order. The steps or functions described with respect to the embodiments of the subject disclosure can be performed alone or in combination with other steps or functions of the subject disclosure, as well as from other embodiments or from other steps that have not been described in the subject disclosure. Further, more than or less than all of the features described with respect to an embodiment can also be utilized.

claim.claim-text: 1. A device, comprising:a processing system including a processor; anda memory that stores executable instructions that, when executed by the processing system, facilitate performance of operations, the operations comprising:transmitting a policy to a first user equipment;obtaining, from the first user equipment and based on the transmitting of the policy to the first user equipment, a first indication that the first user equipment is able to access a communication service via a first radio access technology;responsive to the obtaining of the first indication, configuring the communication service for the first user equipment in accordance with the first radio access technology, resulting in a configured communication service; andproviding the configured communication service to the first user equipment.
2. The device of claim 1, wherein the operations further comprise:receiving a first request for the communication service.
3. The device of claim 2, wherein the receiving of the first request is subsequent to the obtaining of the first indication.
4. The device of claim 2, wherein the receiving of the first request is based on an invocation of an application associated with the communication service at the first user equipment.

5. The device of claim 2, wherein at the time of the receiving of the first request the first user equipment is connected to a network service via a second radio access technology that is different from the first radio access technology.

6. The device of claim 1, wherein the first user equipment determines that the first user equipment is able to access the communication service via the first radio access technology, resulting in a determination, and wherein the first indication includes an indication of the determination.

7. The device of claim 1, wherein the first indication includes an identification of a presence of a cellular radio frequency that is included in a range of frequencies, and wherein the range of frequencies is associated with the first radio access technology.
8. The device of claim 1, wherein the first indication includes a battery level of a battery of the first user equipment.

9. The device of claim 1, wherein the first indication includes an identification of an audio output volume level of the first user equipment, a display capability of the first user equipment, or a combination thereof.
10. The device of claim 1, wherein the first indication includes an identification of a location of the first user equipment.
11. The device of claim 1, wherein the first indication includes an identification of a user of the first user equipment.

12. The device of claim 1, wherein the first indication includes an identification of a consumption of a media item, a recording of the media item, a presentation of the media item, or any combination thereof.
13. The device of claim 1, wherein the communication service includes a streaming video service, a streaming audio service, or a combination thereof.
14. The device of claim 1, wherein the communication service is associated with a social media platform.

15. The device of claim 1, wherein the operations further comprise:transmitting the policy to a second user equipment;obtaining, from the second user equipment and based on the transmitting of the policy to the second user equipment, a second indication that the second user equipment is able to access the communication service via a second radio access technology that is different from the first radio access technology;responsive to the obtaining of the second indication, configuring the communication service for the second user equipment in accordance with the second radio access technology, resulting in a second configured communication service; andproviding the second configured communication service to the second user equipment.

16. A non-transitory machine-readable medium, comprising executable instructions that, when executed by a processing system including a processor, facilitate performance of operations, the operations comprising:performing a first action in accordance with a policy;determining, based on the performing of the first action, that the processing system can access a communication service via a first radio access technology, resulting in a first determination;transmitting a first indication of the first determination; andaccessing the communication service via the first radio access technology based on the transmitting of the first indication.

17. The non-transitory machine-readable medium of claim 16, wherein the performing of the first action includes detecting a presence of a cellular radio frequency that is included in a range of frequencies, and wherein the range of frequencies is associated with the first radio access technology.

18. The non-transitory machine-readable medium of claim 16, wherein the operations further comprise:performing a second action in accordance with policy subsequent to the accessing of the communication service via the first radio access technology;determining, based on the performing of the second action, that the processing system can access the communication service via a second radio access technology that is different from the first radio access technology, resulting in a second determination;transmitting a second indication of the second determination; andaccessing the communication service via the second radio access technology based on the transmitting of the second indication.

19. The non-transitory machine-readable medium of claim 16, wherein the operations further comprise:transmitting a request for the communication service subsequent to the transmitting of the first indication of the first determination,wherein the accessing of the communication service via the first radio access technology is further based on the transmitting of the request.

20. A method, comprising:obtaining, by a processing system including a processor, an indication that a communication device can access a communication service via a first radio access technology;configuring, by the processing system and responsive to the obtaining of the indication, the communication service in accordance with the first radio access technology, resulting in a configured communication service; andproviding, by the processing system, the configured communication service to the communication device.
